Iran launched the ballistic missiles and over 100 drones at Israel as part of their retaliatory response to Israeli attacks on nuclear sites and Iranian officials. All of the drones were shot down by Israeli forces and other air defenses in the region, with very few reaching Israeli territory.

The shell hit an area where explosive gunpowder was stored, triggering a massive explosion. Democratic Voice of Burma, Kachin News Group, and Mizzima reported that the explosion killed 2 civilians and injured more than 30 others. Shwe Phee Myay News Agency and Myanmar Pressphoto Agency reported that the explosion killed 3 civilians, including a woman, and injured 10 others, including two women. The explosion also destroyed eight company dormitory buildings, one Baw-Hoe (excavator), two cars, one 4-wheel family vehicle, one SURF vehicle, two dump trucks, two drilling machines, and two fuel tanks. Additionally, 35 civilian homes, a COC church, an AG church, and the Saung Chain Dhamma Hall were also damaged. Shan Herald Agency for News reported that the Myanmar military forces dropped bombs from a helicopter and killed 3 civilians. Fatalities coded as 3 using the most recent estimate.

actors: Military Forces of Ukraine (2019-) Air Force

actors: Military Forces of Russia (2000-) Air Force
Military Forces of Ukraine (2019-) Air Force
properties.notes: On 1 June 2025, drones that were launched by the Ukrainian Main Directorate of Intelligence struck the military airfield 'Dyagilevo' in Ryazan. Russian military also shot down Ukrainian drones, causing the debris to fall over the city. No civilian casualties, 1 apartment building roof was damaged. Overall casualties unknown. At the airfield, at least 1 TU-22M3 aircraft was struck directly by an FPV-drone. This attack was part of the large scale operation of the Ukrainian Intelligence 'Pavutina' - Spider's Web (each event coded separately). According to the Ukrainian officials, 117 FPV-drones were utilized for the operation and that 34% of all Russian strategic cruise missile carriers - 41 Russian aircraft (including A-50 'Mainstays', Tu-95 'Bears', Tu-22M3 'Backfires', Tu-160 'Blackjacks' were destroyed across 5 regions. Russian MoD reported that there were no military casualties or destroyed vehicles across 5 regions. NATO counted 10-13 destroyed and 40 damaged aircraft.

actors: Military Forces of Russia (2000-) Air Force
Military Forces of Ukraine (2019-) Air Force
properties.notes: On 1 June 2025, drones that were launched by an agent(s) of the Ukrainian Main Directorate of Intelligence struck the military airbase 'Belaya' in Sredniy (Usolskiy, Irkutsk). Local Governor stated that there were no civilian casualties and damages. Overall casualties unknown. The drones were launched from the inside of a truck that was parked at a local tire shop. An unidentified number of drones was intercepted by the Russian military and the random civilian passersby who attempted to down the drones with sticks and stones. This attack was part of the large scale operation of the Ukrainian Intelligence 'Pavutina' - Spider's Web (each event coded separately). According to the Ukrainian officials, 117 FPV-drones were utilized for the operation and that 34% of all Russian strategic cruise missile carriers - 41 Russian aircraft (including A-50 'Mainstays', Tu-95 'Bears', Tu-22M3 'Backfires', Tu-160 'Blackjacks' were destroyed across 5 regions. Satellite footage showed that at least 6 jets were destroyed at the 'Belaya' airfield. Russian MoD reported an unspecified number of aircraft damaged across Irkutsk and Murmansk regions, and that there were no military casualties or destroyed vehicles across 5 regions. NATO counted 10-13 destroyed and 40 damaged aircraft. This is a first recorded drone attack on the territory of the Irkutsk Oblast.

actors: Military Forces of Ukraine (2019-) Air Force

According to some Russian sources, 5 drones were also shot down over Novomaltinsk by the local civilians armed with rifles.

On 2 June 2025, government forces (coded as SSPDF), suspected to be supported by Ugandan troops, conducted an airstrike targeting Old Fangak market, at the river site in Old Fangak Payam, Fangak County (Fangak, Jonglei). The incident led to the displacement of an unspecified number of civilians. Casualties unknown.

On 2 June 2025, government forces (coded as SSPDF), suspected to be supported by Ugandan troops, conducted an airstrike targeting Man-kuei and Kolnyang areas in Phom Payam, Fangak County (location coded to New Fangak, the nearest known location in Fangak County, Jonglei State). The incident led to the displacement of an unspecified number of civilians. Casualties unknown.

On 5 June 2025, government forces (coded as SSPDF) conducted airstrikes in Awudu area of Toch North Payam, Gogrial East County (location coded to Adier Chien, the nearest known location in Gogrial East County, Warrap State), resulting in 1 injury while a health center was destroyed. The airstrikes were suspected to have targeted cattle raiders who had earlier attacked a cattle camp in the area (coded separately), but had already left. A local official confirmed the airstrikes, which were also conducted in neighbouring Tonj North County (coded separately), but claimed they were only meant to deter clashes between armed youth who were mobilizing to face each other. One source claimed that the airstrikes targeted Malual Kuel, Malual Adoor, and Awutwut areas (further information unknown/not reported).

On 5 June 2025, government forces (coded as SSPDF) conducted airstrikes at an unspecified area in Tonj North County (location coded to Warrap Town, the Tonj North County headquarters in Warrap State). The airstrikes were suspected to have targeted cattle raiders who had earlier attacked a cattle camp in Gogrial East County (coded separately). A local official confirmed the airstrikes, which were also conducted in neighboring Gogrial East County (coded separately), but claimed they were only meant to deter clashes between armed youth who were mobilizing to face each other. The official noted that calm has returned to the area and all communities from Tonj North County were holding a peace conference in Louthok-Nyanakuach Payam. There were no casualties.

On 4 June 2025, an Israeli drone conducted an airstrike targeting an ammunition depot near Rabiah town west of Hama - Airbase in Hama countryside, which caused large explosions killing 8 people from the Alawite sect including three women, and injuring others some of whom seriously, while they were in a vehicle passing near the site of the explosion. 8 fatalities.
On 3 June 2025, Israeli warplanes conducted airstrikes targeting Tall al Shaar in rural Quneitra. Casualties unknown.
On 3 June 2025, Israeli warplanes conducted airstrikes targeting the Kanaker area in Rural Damascus. Casualties unknown.

On 2 June 2025, Turkish forces conducted a drone strike targeting a QSD position near the village of Jalabiyeh in the countryside of Aleppo. Casualties unknown.

On 5 June 2025, unknown gunmen suspected to be Bedouins tribal militiamen targeted the outskirts of Al Bustan town in Lajat area in Dara countryside with ground anti-aircraft weapons. Casualties unknown.

On 3 June 2025, Israeli fighters shelled the vicinity of Koya town in the Yarmouk Basin in rural Dara with artillery, with between three and five shells landing in agricultural land between Koya and Ma'ariyah villages without causing any casualties.
On 4 June 2025, Israeli forces based in Western Tall al Ahmar shelled the area between Breiqa and Kodneh towns in Quneitra countryside with three artillery shells. Casualties unknown.

On 3 June 2025, an unidentified armed group in Syria fired two rockets toward the Golan Heights that fell in open areas near Ramat Magshimim (Al Fiq, Quneitra). The newly formed groups Islamic Resistance Front and Martyr Muhammad Deif Brigades both claimed responsibility for the rockets. Neither claim could be verified.

On 10 June 2025, US forces operating under the Global Coalition conducted a drone strike targeting a motorcycle carrying two individuals along the Bardaqli - Dana road near Dana town in rural northern Idleb who are suspected to be former members of the defunct Hurras al Din faction, killing both and destroying the motorcycle. 2 fatalities.

actors: Islamic State in Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)
properties.notes: On 10 June 2025, US forces operating under the Global Coalition conducted a drone strike targeting a vehicle along the Atmah road near the Karamah Camps in rural Idleb, killing one ISIL commander, injuring three others including two individuals nearby and burning the vehicle. The victim is accused of planning operations that posed a threat to US civilians and partners. 1 fatality.

On 8 June 2025, Israeli forces conducted a drone strike targeting a vehicle near the village of Mazraet Beit Jin in Rural Damascus, killing one individual and wounding two others. Israeli forces stated that the strike targeted a member of the Hamas movement. However, other sources indicated that the individuals targeted were former opposition rebels who had recently returned to their hometown. 1 fatality.

actors: Military Forces of Russia (2000-) Air Force
properties.notes: On 7 June 2025, Russian forces launched an air strike at Kharkiv, Kharkiv region, with 53 drones, 4 guided aerial bombs and a missile, presumably Kh-35. A civilian enterprise, an educational facility and 56 civilian houses were damaged. 3 civilians were killed, 22 people, including 1 emergency worker, 2 police officers and 5 enterprise workers, were injured. Another two civilians were killed and five others were injured after a strike by two Russian guided aerial bombs. The body of the sixth killed civilian was extracted on 12 June, bringing the total number of killed civilians to 6.

properties.notes: On 3 June 2025, IRG forces destroyed (likely via shelling or artillery) a Houthi artillery position in the Al Jadafir area (Al Hazm, Al Jawf), causing unspecified 'major losses.' Casualties unknown.

On 1 June 2025, Saudi forces (coded under ORH) shelled using artillery fire the Uzlat Ghafirah region (Al Dhaher, Sadah) in Yemen, killing a number of cattle and causing material damage to civilian properties.
On 3 June 2025, Houthi forces fired mortar shells toward civilian homes in Taizz - Al Bararah (Al Mudhaffar, Taizz). Casualties unknown.

On 3 June 2025, Houthi forces positioned in the Al Harir area fired a 23 mm projectile toward a civilian home in Taizz - Shubat Karimah (Al Qahirah, Taizz), causing material damage. There were no casualties.

actors: Military Forces of Yemen (2022-) Presidential Leadership Council
properties.notes: On 9 June 2025, Islah-affiliated IRG forces fired artillery shells at civilian residences in the neighborhood of Al Amal Ahfad Bilal Al Jumlah Al Qadim in Salh district (coded to district center Taizz - Salh) (Taizz), causing material damages and 4 civilian injuries, including 3 children one of whom aged 4 years old.

On 10 June 2025, Israeli warships, including a Sa'ar 6-class corvette, stationed in the North Red Sea fired two long-range guided missiles at Al Hudaydah - Port (Al Hali, Al Hudaydah). The Israeli military claimed that the attack targeted unspecified Houthi targets at the port. This was the first Israeli attack on Yemen to be conducted by the navy, as the Air Force conducted all previous attacks. Casualties unknown.
